title.narrative: Senegal Quality and Equity of Basic Education

description.narrative: The project development objective is to improve learning outcomes for early grades, increase access to the science and mathematics tracks of secondary schools, and to improve equity in access to basic education.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Updating of Manual of Procedures | Description :The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after theProject Effective Date, revise and update, in accordance with terms of reference acceptable to the Association, the proceduresmanual | Due Date :23-january-2019

The Recipient shall no later than one (1) month from the Effectiveness date revise and update, in accordance with terms ofreference acceptable to the Bank, a procedures manual, in accordance with Schedule 2.I.B.1(a) of the grant agreement.

The Recipient shall recruit for the Project no later than two (2) months from the Effective Date, or a later date agreed upon inwriting with the Bank, a procurement specialist, with terms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Bank,in accordance with Schedule 2.IV of the grant agreement.

The Recipient shall recruit for the Project shall no later than three (3) months from the Effective Date, or a later date agreedupon in writing with the Bank, recruit an internal auditor, with terms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory tothe Bank, in accordance with Schedule 2.IV of the grant agreement.

title.narrative: number of school community members trained using the revised materials in local languages

% of Academic Inspectorates and Inspectorates of Training and Education have at least two officials in HR, statistics, and budget management trained to handle the transferred roles and responsibilitie
% of newly recruited teachers trained and certified in CRFPE using the new training program
Number of out of school children back into the system
Progress realized in the registration of children outside the system in the catch-up program in the 5 selected regions are qualified as satisfactory

Utility of the learning assessment system
At least 500 daara contracts negotiated and signed between IEFs and Borom daaras are implemented

Increase in the % of students who, by the end of grade 2 and 4 of primary schooling, demonstrate their ability to compute and solve grade level math problems

A human resources (HR), statistics and budget management system including software and equipment is established in all Academic Inspectorates and in all Training and Education Inspectorates (Yes/No, C
A regional education report is produced yearly
EMIS system (SIMEN) in place and functional
All 16 IAs submitted their report including outputs, results and agreed supporting documents
System for learning assessment at the primary level
